meanings.definition: An imaging device used to create detailed cross-sectional images of the body.
meanings.sent1: The tomograph at the hospital helped doctors see inside the patient's body.
meanings.sent2: The technician operated the tomograph to capture images of the patient's organs.
meanings.sent3: The tomograph seemed like a magical camera revealing hidden body secrets.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a tomograph, scanning memories with precision.
meanings.sent5: The tomograph hummed softly as it unveiled the inner workings of the body.

meanings.definition: To use a tomograph to produce images of the body.
meanings.sent1: Doctors tomograph to diagnose illnesses accurately.
meanings.sent2: She will tomograph the patient to check for any internal injuries.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally tomographed his lunch instead of the patient's body.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes tomographed the scene, capturing every detail in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The machine tomographs swiftly, revealing hidden truths beneath the skin.
